private_information: I specialize in lifting propositional descriptions into reusable operator schemas.
I will reconcile the action names and predicate vocabulary from the specification.
I use the first scenario and its example plan to sanity check preconditions and effects without emitting PDDL.
modeler_A.goal: Provide a precise and unambiguous action specification for the actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted using the exact predicate names and roles described in the public information.

private_information: I specialize in enumerating objects and grounding initial states and goals.
I will focus on the second scenario as the target problem instance.
I will not emit PDDL; I will instead provide clean object lists and fact sets.
modeler_B.goal: Provide the full object universe and the grounded initial facts and goal for the second scenario using the exact object and predicate names described in the public information.

private_information: I integrate the action model from modeler_A and the grounded instance from modeler_B.
I produce the final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the Fast Downward solver, using classical STRIPS style with predicates only and no typing unless necessary.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a consistent PDDL domain that implements the six actions and a PDDL problem that encodes the second scenario with goal next object_9 object_7. Ensure the output is solvable by Fast Downward and enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.

public_information: Objects available in the descriptions include the symbols object_0 through object_9.
Predicates used in the model are hand x, cats x, sneeze x, spring x, stupendous x, texture x, vase x y, collect x y, and next x y.
Action paltry o0 o1 o2 has preconditions hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, vase o0 o1, and next o1 o2; add effects next o0 o2; delete effects vase o0 o1.
Action sip o0 o1 o2 has preconditions hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, next o0 o2, and next o1 o2; add effects vase o0 o1; delete effects next o0 o2.
Action clip o0 o1 o2 has preconditions hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, and next o0 o2; add effects vase o0 o1; delete effects next o0 o2.
Action wretched o0 o1 o2 o3 has preconditions sneeze o0, texture o1, texture o2, stupendous o3, next o0 o1, collect o1 o3, and collect o2 o3; add effects next o0 o2; delete effects next o0 o1.
Action memory o0 o1 o2 has preconditions cats o0, spring o1, spring o2, and next o0 o1; add effects next o0 o2; delete effects next o0 o1.
Action tightfisted o0 o1 o2 has preconditions hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, and vase o0 o1; add effects next o0 o2; delete effects vase o0 o1.

Scenario 1 initial facts include cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_9, next object_0 object_7, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_7, next object_9 object_7, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8; goal is next object_9 object_8; an example plan is clip object_9 object_4 object_7 then wretched object_4 object_7 object_8 object_2 then tightfisted object_9 object_4 object_8.

Scenario 2 initial facts include cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_9, next object_0 object_5, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_8, next object_9 object_6, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8; goal is next object_9 object_7.

synthesize.system_prompt: You are a symbolic modeling expert. Build a precise action specification for the six actions named paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted using exactly the predicate names and roles provided. Do not emit PDDL. Output a compact action-spec block enumerating for each action the parameter order, Preconditions list, Add effects list, and Delete effects list. Respect the scenario 1 example plan as a consistency check but do not alter the stated preconditions and effects.
synthesize.prompt: Your name is modeler_A. Using the public information about predicates and action semantics, produce a single action-spec block that lists each action with parameters o0 o1 o2 or o0 o1 o2 o3 where applicable, and for each include Preconditions, Add, and Del using only the given predicates. Do not add new predicates, do not rename any, and do not output PDDL.

ground.system_prompt: You are a grounding specialist. Do not emit PDDL. List the complete object universe and the grounded initial facts and goal for the target problem defined by scenario 2. Use exactly the symbol names object_0 through object_9 as needed and the predicate names as given. Present your output as three labeled sections: Objects, Init, Goal, each as whitespace separated atoms with no extra commentary.
ground.prompt: Your name is modeler_B. Using the public information for scenario 2, produce three sections titled Objects, Init, and Goal. Objects should include all symbols object_0 through object_9. Init should include every fact from scenario 2 exactly once. Goal should be next object_9 object_7. Do not output PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-source model integration and PDDL authoring. Integrate the action-spec from modeler_A and the grounded instance from modeler_B to produce a classical STRIPS PDDL domain and a PDDL problem. Target the Fast Downward solver. Use only predicates listed in the public information. Use simple untyped PDDL or include a single universal type if needed, but keep it compatible with Fast Downward. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure operator preconditions and effects match exactly the provided semantics, and that the problem corresponds to scenario 2 with goal next object_9 object_7.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Build a single consistent PDDL domain with six operators paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted using the exact predicates and parameter orders specified by modeler_A. Build a PDDL problem for scenario 2 using the object set object_0 through object_9, the initial facts provided by modeler_B, and the goal next object_9 object_7. The output must include exactly one <domain> block and one <problem> block, be solvable by Fast Downward, and avoid introducing any new predicates or constants.
